poem:
Title: Epilogue of a Stolen Innocence

Coins change hands,
a hollow relief.
Ghost of scandal, stench of deceit,
Held by Glitter's shadowed fame.

Layers of pain, no verdict can untie,
Rivers of regret, a youth enslaved.
A court's decree, a price proclaimed,
Yet, in her eyes, no dollar can reclaim.

Time's record etched, not in precious metal,
But in strained hearts, silent and brittle,
Her strength, her tears - justice's riddle.
